reqs:
Title: The Neurophysiology of Movement Control. Description: An examination of the neuroanatomical and functional neurophysiological processes involved in the sensory and motor control of movement, posture, balance and Kinesthesis. Clinical examples of neurological diseases that effect human movement control will also be incorporated. Emphasis is placed on a critical analysis of the scientific literature as well as on grant writing.
Class is held in War Memorial Gym Room 100
courseName: Special Topics in Kinesiology - SPEC TPCS KIN
